Given an arbitrary point "P" in design space, comprised of the 
following:
=
(a) problem specific inputs (PSIs);
(b) auxiliary additional parameters ass=
ociated w/ PSIs;
(c) problem specific outputs (PSOs);
(d) auxiliary additio=
nal parameters associated w/ PSOs;

An instance of a struct of items identi=
fied in (a) through (d) above, 
which taken together comprise a design poin=
t P[i], a vector of which 
comprises the current substrate resolution.

Sub=
strate Inputs: comprised of PSIs, "a" above;
Substrate Outputs: comprised o=
f PSOs, "c" above;

Hypercube Inputs: comprised of auxiliary additional par=
ameters 
associated w/ PSIs & PSOs, "b" & "d" above;
Hypercube Output: weig=
ht between current pair of nodes

Questions:
(1) When the dimensionality of=
 "b" and "d" differ, how is the 
hypercube input topology reconciled?
(2) A=
re there different hypercube networks depending on if the 
current node (in=
put or output), is a substrate input, hidden or 
output node?
(3) How are s=
ubstrate hidden nodes handled when the hypercube is 
focused on the associa=
ted connecting substrate weight? (variation on 
question 2)

Thanks,
   And=
y Carl
